abilitygroupdescription.p: Elemental magic is a special sub-type of evocation that uses the limited, but more stable magic from the nearby elemental planes.

abilitydescription.p: The chaster creates a giant humanoid construct out of soil.
The casters hands become engulfed in primal fire. In hand to hand combat their hands gain the Fire tag and do d6 extra damage.
This ability represents knowledge of elemental magic, the elemental planes and its inhabitants.
The caster shoots a ball for fire from their hands at an opponent.
The caster and all their carried goods turn into a smoke which allows them to pass through doors, up chimneys etc.
The caster touches a target and then casts this spell. Casting is close to instantaneous.

When cast the targets lungs fill with water and they cannot breath, they fall to the ground coughing and gagging. The effects of this spell depend on the narrative imperative and the whim of the GM. Either the target falls to the ground choking for 1d3+1 rounds, or the target dies, no save. FIXME: TIE THE BEHAVIOUR TO THE TYPE OF THE TARGET (SEE GMG).
The caster causes a fog to form by draining the temperature from the surrounds. If fog is peculiar at that location and time then people may notice something strange about the fog.
When casting shatter the caster intones magical words and strikes a target of stone, metal or ice (in fact anything elemental in nature, including wood).
This spell is particularly effective for bringing down structures supported by columns or arches. However city walls and tower are designed to take a lot of damage without failing.

This spell may also be used to attack a subset of monsters, including earth and water elementals, metalic, stone or earthen constructs, and natural wooden animates. For most other creatures this spell does no damage. Against these monsters roll to hit with a grounding weapon (staff or spear) and the spell does Weapon damage plus an additional 10+7xRank damage.

Creates a weasel out of smoke that does what the caster asks of it. Dissipates after five minutes. The caster must have a source of smoke which they inhale and then breathe out in to their hands into something with the rough form of a weasel. The smoke weasel may be used to fetch things or carry small objects. The smoke weasel dissipates after a few minutes. On overcharge the smoke weasel is most likely to attack the caster.

The targets skin takes on a greyish hue and hardens, providing some protection from physical damage. If successful this spell provides a bonus of 2+Rank to armour for five minutes or the rest of the encounter, whichever is longer.
